intro: Wahlenbergia dinteri var. elongata, commonly known as the elongated bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil and full sun.
